poem:
Title: Prospects Unseen 

The grain of Ukraine, 
no reaping in the Black Sea,
Harvest deal undone.

Putin's warriors lurk,
In Lithuanian shadows
European dawn dims.

Risks as vast as ocean,
Alternative trails lie treacherous, 
Greedy Moscow pines.

Interests unserved, perish,
Safety submerged, hope expires - 
Scorched earth, fertile regrets.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war live: Putin victory ‘would not end well for Europe’, Lithuania’s foreign minister says 10.53am GMT The Kremlin on Friday said there was no prospect of reviving the Black Sea grain deal and that alternative routes for shipping Ukrainian grain carried huge risks, Reuters reports. The original deal, which facilitated safe grain exports from Ukraine via the Black Sea, expired last year after Moscow refused to renew it, saying its interests had been ignored.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Russia-Ukraine war live: Putin victory ‘would not end well for Europe’, Lithuania’s foreign minister says 10.53am GMT The Kremlin on Friday said there was no prospect of reviving the Black Sea grain deal and that alternative routes for shipping Ukrainian grain carried huge risks, Reuters reports. The original deal, which facilitated safe grain exports from Ukraine via the Black Sea, expired last year after Moscow refused to renew it, saying its interests had been ignored.
